snippet: A judge vacated the death sentence of a man, five months after the Supreme Court tossed out his conviction in a different case because prosecutors did not turn over key evidence.
abstract: Judge in New Orleans vacates the death sentence of Juan Smith, a convicted murderer, five months after the Supreme Court tossed out his conviction in a different murder case because prosecutors did not turn over key evidence.
lead_paragraph: A judge vacated the death sentence of a man, five months after the Supreme Court tossed out his conviction in a different case because prosecutors did not turn over key evidence.

headline.main: Louisiana: Execution Vacated in Linked Cases
headline.print_headline: Louisiana: Execution Vacated In Linked Cases
